comments.body: Running the command above only updates the modules that are needed for Sherlock to run. If you want the latest version of Sherlock, you have to reclone or download it from this repo. We currently do not have an option to forcefully update Sherlock from the command line.

title: Names with spaces not working on SoundCloud
body: Usernes with a space are not found on SoundCloud.com
author: Vanceagher

comments.body:
Hi @Vanceagher,

Usernames tend to not have spaces. They are usually a single string of alphanumeric characters and sometimes including underscores and certain special characters.
So usernames with spaces not working on SoundCloud is normal behavior. I doubt it works on any other site as well.

Hey @bossauh,

Im really sorry for the late reply. Are you still having this issue? I just tested everything it seems like everything it fine on my end. I think the reason why Letterboxd is getting stuck is because of your internet connection.

title: Permission denied
body: I was getting the "permission denied" prompt on windows 10 with Git Bash when trying to install the requirements after cloning the repo. I bypassed this by installing mitproxy. Now however, I get permission denied when trying to run a "python3 sherlock.py username" command. Not sure how I can even fix this on my end?
author: chromechris

comments.body:
To install the requirements, run this command:
```
pip install --user -r requirements.txt
```

If you are using the latest version of Sherlock all you have to do is run this:
```
python3 sherlock username
```
You dont need the ".py" extension.
If you are on Windows, you should use `python` not `python3`.

This issue is 2 months old and there doesn't seem to be any updates from @chromechris. I will assume that they have successfully fixed the issue that they were having. I am closing this so that the list of issues can be kept nice and tidy.

title: Massive Issues
body:
Getting Errors Connecting to :
 Aptoide, Basecamp, Carbonmade, ColourLovers, Crevado, Itch.Io, Jimdo, Rajce.net, Webnode, Wix. As of today it is also crashing and causing complete system freezes on both systems I am utilizing it on, 1 is a Virtual Box Kali Linux 2.0 the other is a dedicated Kali Linux 2.0 system . 

Another common problem is if you use say "First.Lastname" it will get results for say www.com/independent.academia.edu/FIRSTNAME instead of www.com/independent.academia.edu/FIRSTNAME.LASTNAME 

this is on quite a few of the search as well. 

I have also observed that when you run FirstName.LastName say
Python3 sherlock.py firstname.lastname -r it produces "Illegal Username Format" 

another issue is i'll go to run sherlock and it returns only 3 results and ends. 

Distributor ID:	Kali
Description:	Kali GNU/Linux Rolling
Release:	2019.3
Codename:	kali-rolling

using latest version of sherlock
author: ghost

comments.body:
It does sounds like there is some issue with your environment.  Some sites do not respond if they don't like the IP address that you are coming from.

The error message with the "Illegal Username Format" is because some sites do not accept usernames with a "." in them.  If Sherlock said that there was no username like that (which would be true), it would still be misleading: no one could have a username with a "." at that site.

Unfortunately, we do not have the checking for the valid username format for all sites.  So, some messages reporting available usernames may not be actually true.

Can you try it now with the latest content on master (version 0.10.0)? In #471, I placed a limit on the number of threads that can be allocated. And, it did not seem to make any difference on performance.

Other people have been having other symptoms, but I wonder if this bug may have been what you have been seeing.

Closing this issue out, as I believe it was involved in the earlier versions of Sherlock that did not place any limit on the number of workers when doing requests.  As more sites were added, it would bring any computer to its (virtual) knees.

```
python3 sherlock.py user
```

```
import requests
ModuleNotFoundError:  No module named 'requests'.
```

Can anyone help me to solve this?  Thanks.
author: TechGirl007

comments.body:
Hey @TechGirl007 

Have you installed all the required modules by running this command?
```bash
$ pip3 install -r requirements
```

Hi @sdushantha 
Yes.  :(  Did it twice - so not sure if that is the problem!  Says all installed!
i met the same problem with you, so,have you solve it ?

Hi @dewjiguang   Yup...still same problem. There is no module called requests.  I installed the module into python but the installation seems to go to a file of python2.7 that came with Kali originally.  I have a few other ideas to install the module in python 3.7.  But at the moment... I'm still getting the same reading even with the new request module that I installed.  Any help would be appreciated!  Thanks

You need to have the dependencies installed for Python 3.7.  If you are actually running the pip for Python 2.7, the dependencies will not change for Python 3.7.

Try typing the following:

```
% pip3 --version
pip 19.0.3 from c:\python36\lib\site-packages\pip (python 3.6)
```

Your results will be different, but it should show you the version of Python and where the main Python engine is installed.

Error:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "sherlock.py", line 21, in <module>
    import requests
  File "/home/qphy/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/requests/__init__.py", line 43, in <module>
    import urllib3
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'urllib3'

@Arsaamkhan you need to have the requirements installed.  You can see from the error message that your Python install does not have urllib3, and Sherlock needs that.

As it says in the readme, you have to run a command like the below:
```
$ python3 -m pip install -r requirements.txt
```

Requirement already satisfied: urllib3 in /usr/lib/python3/dist-packages (1.24.1)

with the same command you mentioned above.
on which system have u tested sherlock  ?
after that i had tried sherlock in Termux (Android App) and it worked.
@TechGirl007 try running sherlock on Parrot os it worked for me
This issue appears to be an environmental issue rather than a problem with Sherlock itself.  It also has been hanging out for some time.  So, I am closing it out now to remove the clutter.
I have the same error

title: Username with Space
body: How I can search a Username with a Space
author: T2brozz

comments.body:
You just need to quote the user name on the command line.  Here is an example using a Git Bash shell on Windows 10:
```
python -u sherlock.py --site twitter "name space"
```

Keep in mind that there are probably many sites that do not allow spaces in the user name.  Sherlock does not have many of the validity checks configured, so a name that may claim to be available might actually  be illegal.
Thanks

`python sherlock "username"`
this command works for username with spaces and extracts info about users from all the sites which are in sites.md

ERROR: Command "/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/bin/python -u -c 'import setuptools, tokenize;__file__='"'"'/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/tmp/pip-install-h6re8a7a/lxml/setup.py'"'"';f=getattr(tokenize, '"'"'open'"'"', open)(__file__);code=f.read().replace('"'"'\r\n'"'"', '"'"'\n'"'"');f.close();exec(compile(code, __file__, '"'"'exec'"'"'))' install --record /data/data/com.termux/files/usr/tmp/pip-record-ldgldbx4/install-record.txt --single-version-externally-managed --compile" failed with error code 1 in /data/data/com.termux/files/usr/tm     "

title: Ideas On Choosing The Perfect Unclaimed Username?
body:
One of the pains in delivering on #37 is that I need to figure out an unclaimed username (to verify that Sherlock can correctly detect that a given username is open).

I have been using "noonewouldeverusethis7" as this username, because...who would use something like that?  However, sometime in the last couple of days, someone has claimed that username on BuzzFeed and Canva.  The irony is not lost on me.

So, my questions are twofold:
1. Does anyone have ideas on how to choose usernames that no one else has claimed?
2. Does anyone know how these names might get claimed just from Sherlock doing queries against them?  I find it hard to believe that "noonewouldeverusethis7" just randomly got claimed.
author: hoadlck

comments.body:
I was thinking about generating a random alphabetical string, testing, and repeating this process once or twice.

This way, we get usernames that are very unlikely to be in use, and prevent people from claiming usernames that are in the source of Sherlock.

I think I could submit a pull request this weekend for the false positive testing, if no one else wants this issue of course.

Please let me know your thoughts.

Afterthought: perhaps we could also generate random usernames based on the regex that describes valid usernames per website, but that might be a V2 of this functionality?

The current tests only check one username per site query. So, the test for unclaimed detection would have to be changed.  If the tests always had to try multiple usernames to find an unclaimed one, it would really extend the test times.

I guess what I am really worrying about is how exactly the existing site got the "noonewouldeverusethis7" username. If this is something that is happening on the site side, then the entire approach of Sherlock is called into question.  It is only going to work if it was someone in the Sherlock community that is defining them.
using a username that can't be used in the sites could be an option, like username with less than 3 chars or more than 52 chars in some sites.
Using a somewhat long username (more than 50 chars or something) may be an quite good approach.

`import time ; f"user{time.time_ns()}".rstrip('0')` --> user1657191108413085

It will be difficult for spammers to guess which nanosecond the test will run.
We have removed unclaimed usernames from `data.json`. For the sites that need it for the tests, we use `exrex` to generate a random username based on the `regexCheck` regex :)

title: Instagram do not works
body:
# Sherlock doesnt find any username for instagram.

I am looking for a user who has an instagram account but sherlock cannot find the account with the same username.
author: fntkg

comments.body: @fntkg This is a strange issue. Someone did email me about this but I haven't been able to figure out why this is happening. I am able to check if a username exists on Instagram on a seperate script, but it fails when using Sherlock.

Yes, for Instagram, it is not showing username. 

```
[-] Instagram: Not Found!
```
Okay I figured it out. Instagram has an extra measure in place that doesn't allow HEAD requests. I'll fork and make a pull request. #593
This has been included in #599 as there was a non-trivial merge in including #593.
same issue
As of 9th June 2021, it still doesn't work for Instagram, displaying site not found
Still facing the same issue
Still facing the same issue

title: Prevent copying of venv folder in the Docker image
body:
After diving into the current image I noticed that the `venv` was copied in there. This PR should prevent that from happing in future builds.

### What has been done:
- added venv folder to the .dockerignore

### Notes:
- I also noticed that the current image on docker hub has a layer for `RUN /sbin/apk add tor`. Is this supposed to be there? Maybe we can rebuild the image to reflect the Dockerfile in the repository.
author: nstapelbroek

comments.body: I have not used Docker, so I cannot provide a meaningful review. Perhaps @cblument can take a look?
This is safe to merge
